result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin J Matheus was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution: $4,892.57 individually and $406.00 joint and several with Co-Defendants.  $1,000.00 will be paid today.  Remaining to be paid as a Condition of Probation at the rate of $200.00 per month starting 09-01-2014.

As of 12/24/2016:   Pursuant to Supreme Court decision in State v Elward, 2015 WI App 51, 363, DNA surcharge is vacated and modified to zero.

Costs and Surcharges to be paid during the term of Probation as a Condition of Probation; alternate of 134 hours of Community Service to be completed by the completion of Probation. Court must receive notice of completion prior to end of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Sign any/all Medical Releases for Agent.
No contact with Wrico.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time:  4 Months Huber - Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED and to be used at the Agent's discretion.

miscConds.notes: As of 12/27/2016:  Pursuant to Supreme Court decision in State v Elward, 2015 WI App 51, 363, DNA surcharge is vacated and modified to zero.

Defendant Justin J Matheus in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has $1,000.00 towards restitution to pay today.  Atty. Kershek will pay after today's hearing.  

The Court Orders the Following:

COUNT 3
Withheld Sentence of:
(Credit - 0 days if revoked)

Term of Probation: 2 Years

Conditions of Probation:
- AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
- Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
- No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
- No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
- Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed;
- Inform agent of all prescriptions;
- Sign Medical Release for Agent;
- No contact with Wrico.

Restitution: $4892.57 individually and $406.00 joint and several with co-defendants  ($1,000.00 will be paid today.  Remaining to be paid at the rate of $200.00 per month commencing 9-1-14)

Costs: $253.00 
DNA Surcharge:  $200.00

Condition Time: 4 months Huber NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - Stayed and to be used at the agent's discretion.

COUNT 7
Withheld Sentence of:

Term of Probation: 2 Years  CONCURRENT TO COUNT 3

Conditions of Probation: Same as Count 3

Costs: $243.00 
DNA Surcharge:  $200.00

COUNT 8
Withheld Sentence of:

Term of Probation:  2Years  CONCURRENT TO COUNT 3

Conditions of Probation: Same as Count 3

Costs: $243.00 
DNA Surcharge:  $200.00
